intro: Orychophragmus zhongtiaoshanus, commonly known as the Zhongtiaoshan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high altitudes and cool climates, thriving in well-drained soil. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited seed viability, it is considered endangered and requires careful protection.
